tool.name: calcVG_PTFs
tool.displayname: 01 Calculate van Genuchten parameters and plot SMRC

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool should be stored.

param.name: Input_shapefile
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename of the input soil shapefile. Soil shapefile can be polygon or point vector which includes required soil properties of the selected PTFs.

param.name: VG_of_choice
param.displayname: PTFs of choice for van Genuchten model
param.expression: Wosten et al. (1999) topsoil | Wosten et al. (1999) subsoil | Vereecken et al. (1989) | Zacharias and Wessolek (2007) | Weynants et al. (2009) | Dashtaki et al. (2010) | Hodnett and Tomasella (2002)
param.dialogReference: Select the PTFs of interest from the dropdown list.

param.name: Pressure_heads_VG
param.displayname: Specify pressures to calculate water content using van Genuchten and hydraulic conductivity using Mualem-van Genuchten model (space delimited)
param.dialogReference:
In the default, the output will contain soil moisture retention/hydraulic conductivity at -1kPa, -3kPa, -10kPa, -33kPa, -100kPa, -200kPa, -1000kPa and -1500kPa. These will get written to the output shapefile.

Using this option, user can customise the output to get soil moisture/hydraulic conductivity at the pressure of interest other than the default pressures. This information will get written to a CSV file within the output folder.

param.name: FieldCapacity
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at field capacity
param.dialogReference: Specify pressure for field capacity. Field capacity is commonly between -10kPa to -100kPa. The default value is 33kPa.

param.name: SIC
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at water stress-induced stomata closure
param.dialogReference: Specify pressure for water stress-induced stomata closure. The default value is 100kPa.

param.name: PWP
param.displayname: Value of pressure (kPa) at permanent wilting point
param.dialogReference: Specify pressure for permanent wilting point. The default value is 1500kPa.

param.name: Carbon_content
param.displayname: If the selected PTF requires organic carbon or organic matter, select which type is present in your dataset:
param.dialogReference: Specifying soil carbon information in the input data. If the selected PTFs require organic matter (OM) but the input data only has organic carbon (OC) or inversely, this function can be used to convert OM to OC and inversely.

param.name: Conversion_factor
param.displayname: If the selected PTF requires organic carbon or organic matter, enter the appropriate conversion factor to change OM or OC (or vice-versa):
param.dialogReference: LUCI_PTFs gives default conversion factors: 1.724 to convert OC to OM and 0.58 to convert OM to OC. However, user can customise the factor by typing in this parameter.

param.name: Pressure_units_plot
param.dialogReference: Selecting the pressure unit for plotting soil moisture result. LUCI_PTFs has thee pressure unit options: kPa, cm and m.

param.name: Plot_axis
param.displayname: Create water content and pressure plots with water content on the:
param.dialogReference:
Choose which axis water content will be plotted on.

If the option to obtain Mualem-van Genuchten model parameters and hydraulic conductivity pressure relationship is chosen, this choice will influence which axis hydraulic conductivity will be plotted on.

param.name: Calculate_MVG
param.displayname: Estimate unsaturated hydraulic conductivity and generate hydraulic conductivity curve using PTFs for Mualem van Genuchten model
param.dialogReference: Tick this box if you would like to obtain Mualem-van Genuchten model parameters and hydraulic conductivity pressure relationship. You must select either Wösten et al. (1999) or Weynants et al. (2009) PTFs.

tool.summary: This tool provides 6 PTFs to estimate van Genuchten model parameters and soil moisture pressure relationship. Among the 6 PTFs, Wösten et al., 1999 and Weynants et al. (2009) can be used to obtain Mualem van Genuchten model parameters and hydraulic conductivity pressure relationship. To select the PTFs of interest, users can use the guidelines given in the paper “Guidelines and a supporting toolbox for parameterising key soil hydraulic properties in hydrological studies and broader integrated modelling” (Dang et al., 2021).

idCitation.resTitle: 01 Calculate van Genuchten parameters and plot SMRC

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool provides 6 PTFs to estimate van Genuchten model parameters and soil moisture pressure relationship. Among the 6 PTFs, Wösten et al., 1999 and Weynants et al. (2009) can be used to obtain Mualem van Genuchten model parameters and hydraulic conductivity pressure relationship. To select the PTFs of interest, users can use the guidelines given in the paper “Guidelines and a supporting toolbox for parameterising key soil hydraulic properties in hydrological studies and broader integrated modelling” (Dang et al., 2021).
